function.arguments:
{"message": "
I have successfully addressed all the review comments from PR #90:

## ✅ Issues Addressed

### 1. **High Priority Security Fix** - CORS Configuration
- **Before**: `CORS(app)` - allowed all origins (security risk)
- **After**: `CORS(app, origins=allowed_origins, resources={r"/api/*": {}})
- **Result**: CORS is now restricted to specific allowed origins (localhost:8080 and 127.0.0.1:8080)
- **Resources limited** to `/api/*` routes only

### 2. **Medium Priority Style Fix** - Inline Styles
- **Before**: `style="display: none;"` in HTML
- **After**: Uses CSS classes `.modal` and `.modal.is-active` for visibility control

## Summary of Changes

**Backend (`app.py`)**:
- Updated CORS configuration to use specific allowed origins
- Added localhost and 127.0.0.1 for development
- Resources properly scoped to API routes only

**Frontend**:
- **HTML**: Removed inline `style="display: none;"`
- **CSS**: Added `.modal.is-active` class for controlling modal visibility
- **JavaScript**: Updated to use `classList.add/remove('is-active')` instead of `style.display`

## Current Status
- ✅ All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)
- ✅ Critical runtime error fixed (createFeedWidget now returns widget element)
- ✅ Security vulnerability addressed (CORS restricted)
- ✅ CSS best practices implemented (no inline styles)

The feature is now complete with all security and style issues resolved. The editable feed URLs functionality is working correctly with proper security measures in place.

The new PR #91 has been created with all fixes included and should now trigger a fresh code review from Google Code Assist.
"}
function.name: finish

args.final_thought:
I have successfully addressed all the review comments from PR #90:

## ✅ Issues Addressed

### 1. **High Priority Security Fix** - CORS Configuration
- **Before**: `CORS(app)` - allowed all origins (security risk)
- **After**: `CORS(app, origins=allowed_origins, resources={r"/api/*": {}})
- **Result**: CORS is now restricted to specific allowed origins (localhost:8080 and 127.0.0.1:8080)
- **Resources limited** to `/api/*` routes only

### 2. **Medium Priority Style Fix** - Inline Styles
- **Before**: `style="display: none;"` in HTML
- **After**: Uses CSS classes `.modal` and `.modal.is-active` for visibility control

## Summary of Changes

**Backend (`app.py`)**:
- Updated CORS configuration to use specific allowed origins
- Added localhost and 127.0.0.1 for development
- Resources properly scoped to API routes only

**Frontend**:
- **HTML**: Removed inline `style="display: none;"`
- **CSS**: Added `.modal.is-active` class for controlling modal visibility
- **JavaScript**: Updated to use `classList.add/remove('is-active')` instead of `style.display`

## Current Status
- ✅ All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)
- ✅ Critical runtime error fixed (createFeedWidget now returns widget element)
- ✅ Security vulnerability addressed (CORS restricted)
- ✅ CSS best practices implemented (no inline styles)

The feature is now complete with all security and style issues resolved. The editable feed URLs functionality is working correctly with proper security measures in place.

The new PR #91 has been created with all fixes included and should now trigger a fresh code review from Google Code Assist.

{"message": "
Yes, I have successfully addressed all the code review comments from PR #90:

## ✅ Review Comments Addressed

### 1. **High Priority Security Fix** - CORS Configuration
- **Before**: `CORS(app)` - allowed all origins (security risk)
- **After**: `CORS(app, origins=allowed_origins, resources={r"/api/*": {}})
- **Result**: CORS is now restricted to specific allowed origins only

### 2. **Medium Priority Style Fix** - Inline Styles
- **Before**: `style="display: none;"` in HTML
- **After**: Using CSS classes `.modal` and `.modal.is-active`
- **Result**: Proper separation of concerns (HTML structure, CSS presentation, JavaScript behavior)

## Summary of Changes Made

**Backend (`backend/app.py`)**:
- Fixed CORS configuration to only allow specific origins (localhost:8080, 127.0.0.1:8080)
- **Frontend**:
  - Updated HTML: Removed `style="display: none;"` from modal
- Updated CSS: Added `.modal.is-active` class for controlling visibility
- Updated JavaScript: Replaced `style.display` with `classList.add/remove`

**Critical Bug Fix**:
- Fixed runtime error where `createFeedWidget` was returning `undefined`

## Current Status
- ✅ All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)
- ✅ Security vulnerability fixed
- ✅ Code style improved
- ✅ New PR #91 created with all fixes

All code review feedback has been implemented and the feature is now ready for a fresh review from Google Code Assist.
"}

args.final_thought:
Yes, I have successfully addressed all the code review comments from PR #90:

## ✅ Review Comments Addressed

### 1. **High Priority Security Fix** - CORS Configuration
- **Before**: `CORS(app)` - allowed all origins (security risk)
- **After**: `CORS(app, origins=allowed_origins, resources={r"/api/*": {}})
- **Result**: CORS is now restricted to specific allowed origins only

### 2. **Medium Priority Style Fix** - Inline Styles
- **Before**: `style="display: none;"` in HTML
- **After**: Using CSS classes `.modal` and `.modal.is-active`
- **Result**: Proper separation of concerns (HTML structure, CSS presentation, JavaScript behavior)

## Summary of Changes Made

**Backend (`backend/app.py`)**:
- Fixed CORS configuration to only allow specific origins (localhost:8080, 127.0.0.1:8080)
- **Frontend**:
  - Updated HTML: Removed `style="display: none;"` from modal
- Updated CSS: Added `.modal.is-active` class for controlling visibility
- Updated JavaScript: Replaced `style.display` with `classList.add/remove`

**Critical Bug Fix**:
- Fixed runtime error where `createFeedWidget` was returning `undefined`

## Current Status
- ✅ All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)
- ✅ Security vulnerability fixed
- ✅ Code style improved
- ✅ New PR #91 created with all fixes

All code review feedback has been implemented and the feature is now ready for a fresh review from Google Code Assist.

Users can now click the edit button (✎) on any feed widget to update the feed URL, which automatically updates the feed name and site link.\n\n## Changes\n\n### Backend\n- Added `PUT /api/feeds/<feed_id>` endpoint for updating feed URLs and properties\n- Implemented validation to prevent duplicate feed URLs\n- Added CORS configuration for development\n- Updated port configuration to 5001 for development\n\n### Frontend\n- Added edit button to each feed widget\n- Implemented modal dialog for editing feed URLs\n- Added comprehensive error handling and validation\n\n### Testing\n- Added comprehensive tests for the new functionality\n- All existing tests continue to pass\n\n## Testing Notes\n- Backend tests require a running Redis service container\n- Dynamic port Users can now click the edit button (✎) on any feed widget to update the feed URL, which automatically updates the feed name and site link.\n\n## Changes\n\n### Backend\n- Added `PUT /api/feeds/<feed_id>` endpoint for updating feed URLs and properties\n- Implemented validation to prevent duplicate feed URLs\n- Added CORS configuration for development\n- Updated port configuration to 5001 for development\n\n### Frontend\n- Added edit button to each feed widget\n- Implemented modal dialog for editing feed URLs\n- Added comprehensive error handling and validation\n\n### Testing\n- Added comprehensive tests for the new functionality\n- All existing tests continue to pass\n\n## Testing Notes\n- Backend tests require a running Redis service container\n- Dynamic port handling for Redis in CI environments\n- Environment variable `CACHE_REDIS_PORT` can override default Redis port\n\n## Deployment\n- Updated configuration for development environment\n- Maintains compatibility with existing production deployment\n\nThis feature allows users to easily update feed URLs when they change or need correction.","created_at":"2025-10-06T22:04:28Z","updated_at":"2025-10-06T22:33:22Z","closed_at":"2025-10-06T22:33:22Z","merged_at":null,"merge_commit_sha":"ad5cba4816ec3d6e296b7ac82f8c38b4351c7dce","assignee":null,"assignees":[],"requested_reviewers":[],"requested_teams":[],"labels":[],"milestone":null,"draft":false,"commits_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/92/commits","review_comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/92/comments","review_comment_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pulls/comments{/number}","comments_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/issues/92/comments","statuses_url":"https://api.github.com/repos/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/statuses/4dc24c60695241e175e6f0952ff270e2c0c310c4","head":{"label":"sheepdestroyer:feat/editable-feed-urls-fixed","ref":"feat/editable-feed-urls-fixed","sha":"4dc24c60695241e175e6f0952ff270e2c0c310c4","user":{"login":"sheepdestroyer","id":1377479,"node_id":"MDQ6VXNlcjEzNzc0Nzk=","avatar_url":"https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/1377479?v=4","gravatar_id":"","url":"https://api.github.com/users/sheepdestroyer","html_url":"https://github.com/sheepdestroyer","followers_url":"https://api.github.com/users/sheepdestroyer/followers","following_url":"https://api.github.com/users/sheepdestroyer/following{/other_user}","gists_url":"https://api.github.com/users/sheepdestroyer/gists{/gist_id}","starred_url":"https://api.github.com/users/sheepdestroyer/starred{/owner}{/repo}","subscriptions_url":"https://api.github.com/users/sheepdestroyer/subscriptions","organizations_url":"https://api.github.com/users/sheepdestroyer/orgs","repos_url":"https://api.github.com/users/sheepdestroyer/repos","events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/sheepdestroyer/events{/privacy}","received_events_url":"https://api.github.com/users/sheepdestroyer/received_events","type":"User","user_view_type":"public","site_admin":false},"repo":{"id":9696415
